title: Turkish Kebab (Adana Kebab)
steps: In a bowl, combine ground lamb, grated onion (squeeze out excess liquid), garlic, paprika, cumin, red pepper flakes, black pepper, and salt. Mix well and knead for 5 minutes until sticky.
Divide mixture into portions. Mold each portion around flat metal skewers, forming long, thin kebabs.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up.
Preheat grill to high heat. Grill kebabs for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve with flatbread, grilled vegetables, and yogurt. Turkish kebabs should be juicy, spicy, and smoky.

title: Turkish Meze Platter
ingredients: Hummus, Baba ganoush, Stuffed grape leaves
steps: Make cacik (Turkish tzatziki): Mix yogurt, grated cucumber (drained), garlic, olive oil, mint, and salt. Refrigerate.
Arrange hummus, baba ganoush, stuffed grape leaves, feta cheese, olives, cherry tomatoes, and cucumber on a large platter.
Add the cacik in a small bowl. Serve with warm pita bread. Meze should offer a variety of flavors and textures for sharing.

title: Turkish Baklava
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Layer 10 phyllo sheets in a buttered pan, brushing each with butter.
Sprinkle half the pistachios. Add 5 phyllo sheets (buttering each), remaining pistachios, then 10 more phyllo sheets.
Cut into diamonds. Bake 50 minutes until golden.
Make syrup: Boil sugar, water, and lemon juice for 10 minutes. Add rose water. Pour hot syrup over warm baklava.
Cool completely before serving. Turkish baklava is known for its pistachio filling and rose water syrup.

title: Turkish Coffee
steps: Add water, coffee, and sugar (if using) to a cezve (Turkish coffee pot). Stir once.
Heat over low heat. As it begins to foam, remove from heat before it boils over. Let foam settle.
Return to heat and let foam rise again. Repeat once more.
Pour into small cups, allowing grounds to settle. Turkish coffee should be strong, thick, and served with the grounds.

title: Turkish Delight (Lokum)
steps: Grease a 9x9 pan. In a pot, combine 1.5 cups water with cornstarch and cream of tartar. Whisk until smooth.
In another pot, boil sugar with 3 cups water until sugar dissolves. Add to cornstarch mixture.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 45-60 minutes until thick and golden. Add rose water and food coloring.
Pour into prepared pan. Let set overnight. Cut into squares and roll in powdered sugar mixed with cornstarch. Turkish delight should be soft, chewy, and fragrant.
